term.title: filler coke

item.text: The main constituent of a carbon artifact, introduced as solid component (predominantly in the form of particulate carbon) into the 'carbon mix' from which polygranular carbon and graphite materials are obtained by heat treatment.

notes.item: Filler coke is not necessarily the only, but it is commonly the most important filler material used in a 'carbon mix' which consists of filler and binder.

sources.item: PAC, 1995, 67, 473. 'Recommended terminology for the description of carbon as a solid (IUPAC Recommendations 1995)' on page 489 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199567030473)
